title: OTHER SITE RISK FACTORS WHEN EXCAVATING UNDERGROUND
fullText:
Other risk factors shall be considered in the site risk assessment, including the following:
(a) Excavation and pit hazards, such as â€”
(i) depth (shoring may be required); and
(ii) hollows, pits, and sumps, e.g. collection of toxic fumes and gases.
NOTE 1 Air monitoring and confined space entry may be necessary.
(b) Traffic hazards.
(c) Lack of ventilation.
(d) Elevated temperatures.
(e) Induced voltages and transferred earth potential.
NOTE 2 Work site equipotential bonding or complete insulation methods may be necessary.
